verses.verse: In the third<WH7969> year<WH8141> of the reign<WH4438> of Jehoiakim<WH3079> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> came<WH935> Nebuchadnezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> to Jerusalem,<WH3389> and besieged it.<WH6696>

The Lord<WH136> gave<WH5414> Jehoiakim<WH3079> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> into his hand,<WH3027> with part<WH7117> of the vessels<WH3627> of the house<WH1004> of God;<WH430> and he carried<WH935> them into the land<WH776> of Shinar<WH8152> to the house<WH1004> of his god:<WH430> and he brought<WH935> the vessels<WH3627> into the treasure<WH214> house<WH1004> of his god.<WH430>

The king<WH4428> spoke<WH559> to Ashpenaz<WH828> the master<WH7227> of his eunuchs,<WH5631> that he should bring<WH935> in certain of the children<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> even of the seed<WH2233> royal<WH4410> and of the nobles;<WH6579>

youths<WH3206> in whom was no blemish,<WH3971> but well<WH2896> - favored,<WH4758> and skillful<WH7919> in all wisdom,<WH2451> and endowed<WH3045> with knowledge,<WH1847> and understanding<WH995> science,<WH4093> and such as had ability<WH3581> to stand<WH5975> in the king<WH4428>'s palace;<WH1964> and that he should teach<WH3925> them the learning<WH5612> and the language<WH3956> of the Chaldeans.<WH3778>

The king<WH4428> appointed<WH4487> for them a daily<WH3117> portion<WH1697> of the king<WH4428>'s dainties,<WH6598> and of the wine<WH3196> which he drank,<WH4960> and that they should be nourished<WH1431> three<WH7969> years;<WH8141> that at its end<WH7117> they should stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> the king.<WH4428>
Now among these were,<WH1121> of the children of Judah,<WH3063> Daniel,<WH1840> Hananiah,<WH2608> Mishael,<WH4332> and Azariah.<WH5838>

The prince<WH8269> of the eunuchs<WH5631> gave<WH7760> names<WH8034> to them:<WH1840> to Daniel he gave<WH7760> the name of Belteshazzar;<WH1095> and to Hananiah,<WH2608> of Shadrach;<WH7714> and to Mishael,<WH4332> of Meshach;<WH4335> and to Azariah,<WH5838> of Abednego.<WH5664>

But Daniel<WH1840> purposed<WH7760> in his heart<WH3820> that he would not defile<WH1351> himself with the<WH6598> king<WH4428>'s dainties,<WH6598> nor with the wine<WH3196> which he drank:<WH4960> therefore he requested<WH1245> of the prince<WH8269> of the eunuchs<WH5631> that he might not defile himself.<WH1351>
Now God<WH430> made<WH5414> Daniel<WH1840> to find kindness<WH2617> and compassion<WH7356> in the sight<WH6440> of the prince<WH8269> of the eunuchs.<WH5631>

The prince<WH8269> of the eunuchs<WH5631> said<WH559> to Daniel,<WH1840> I fear<WH3373> my lord<WH113> the king,<WH4428> who has appointed<WH4487> your food<WH3978> and your drink:<WH4960> for why should he see<WH7200> your faces<WH6440> worse looking<WH7200> than the youths<WH3206> who are of your own age?<WH1524> so would you endanger<WH2325> my head<WH7218> with the king.<WH4428>

Then Daniel<WH1840> said<WH559> to the steward<WH4453> whom the prince<WH8269> of the eunuchs<WH5631> had appointed<WH4487> over Daniel,<WH1840> Hananiah,<WH2608> Mishael,<WH4332> and Azariah:<WH5838>
Test<WH5254> your servants,<WH5650> I beg you,<WH6235> ten days;<WH3117> and let them give<WH5414> us vegetables<WH2235> to eat,<WH398> and water<WH4325> to drink.<WH8354>

Then let our faces<WH4758> be looked on<WH7200> before<WH6440> you,<WH4758> and the face of the youths<WH3206> who eat<WH398> of the<WH6598> king<WH4428>'s dainties;<WH6598> and as you see,<WH7200> deal<WH6213> with your servants.<WH5650>
So he listened<WH8085> to them in this matter,<WH1697> and proved<WH5254> them ten<WH6235> days.<WH3117>

At the end<WH7117> of ten<WH6235> days<WH3117> their faces<WH4758> appeared<WH7200> fairer,<WH2896> and they were fatter<WH1277> in flesh,<WH1320> than all the youths<WH3206> who ate<WH398> of the<WH6598> king<WH4428>'s dainties.<WH6598>
So the steward<WH4453> took away<WH5375> their dainties,<WH6598> and the wine<WH3196> that they should drink,<WH4960> and gave<WH5414> them pulse.<WH2235>

Now as for these four<WH702> youths,<WH3206> God<WH430> gave<WH5414> them knowledge<WH4093> and skill<WH7919> in all learning<WH5612> and wisdom:<WH2451> and Daniel<WH1840> had understanding<WH995> in all visions<WH2377> and dreams.<WH2472>

At the end<WH7117> of the days<WH3117> which the king<WH4428> had appointed<WH559> for bringing<WH935> them in,<WH8269> the prince of the eunuchs<WH5631> brought<WH935> them in before<WH6440> Nebuchadnezzar.<WH5019>

The king<WH4428> talked<WH1696> with them;<WH4672> and among them all was found none like Daniel,<WH1840> Hananiah,<WH2608> Mishael,<WH4332> and Azariah:<WH5838> therefore stood<WH5975> they before<WH6440> the king.<WH4428>

In every matter<WH1697> of wisdom<WH2451> and understanding,<WH998> concerning which the king<WH4428> inquired<WH1245> of them,<WH4672> he found them ten times<WH6235> better<WH3027> than all the magicians<WH2748> and enchanters<WH825> who were in all his realm.<WH4438>
Daniel<WH1840> continued even to the first<WH259> year<WH8141> of king<WH4428> Cyrus.<WH3566>
